page.title: 08Tourism
page.content: The area is mostly green and wooded. {The River Derwent}winds through a quiet, pleasant valley. The heather covered moors can be seen from Consett town, which stands at 300m and is an old{steel town. {Allensford Park,}a beauty spot, is on the main A68 road to Scotland. Who visits this area? The majority of tourists stay overnight. Those staying longer, visit relations, come on foreign exchanges or to see places of special interest. {TO SEE AND DO Hownsgill Viaduct(and canes)-finished 1857-233m long,58m. high,11 arches. Consett Flea market(Thursdays) General market(Fridays and Saturdays) Fishing(Rainbow /Brown trout) walking in Derwent valley. One Hotel,Y.M.C.A.,Allensford picnic site,39 caravans and 25 tents.
